q: How does Port Charlotte's canal system increase flood risk?
a: Storm surge flows through Peace River and numerous residential canals, raising water up to 4 ft above mean tide. Flood barriers protect garage and entry points from canal back-flow.

q: Do local building codes address dry-floodproofing?
a: Yes—Charlotte County Building Ordinance Sec 3-9-60 references FEMA TB-3. Professional installers must supply certified drawings.

q: Are portable barriers effective in Port Charlotte?
a: Freestanding portable units protect walkways and sliders but require anchoring bags for wind stability. Ideal for temporary use.

q: Can you install within gated communities?
a: Yes—HOA-approved systems available in powder-coat finishes to match façades. Reference powder-coating options.

q: Where is your nearest service center?
a: Our Southwest Florida office is in Punta Gorda, serving Port Charlotte and surrounding coastal areas. Contact via local page.
